headline.main: A VISIT TO HARPER'S FERRY.; ARRIVAL AT SANDY HOOK. THE DEVASTATED TOWS. PRIVATE PROPERTY SPARED. DESTRUCTION OF CORN, &C. EVACUATION OF HARPER'S FERRY. THE MARYLAND HEIGHTS. THE MOUNTAIN BATTERIES, LTC. THE RETIRING ARMY. THE FLAG OF THE CONFEDERACY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Harper's Ferry has acquired additional historic interest since my last exciting visit several weeks ago, and my curiosity to behold again its now classic scenes underwent a proportionate augmentation. It was stronger even than my appetite for the legislative "feast of reason and flow of and so-forth," which it has been my professional duty to dish up for the public convenience for the past fortnight, and I went.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT HARPER'S FERRY.; REPORTS FROM HAGERSTOWN.

docs.lead_paragraph: An express messenger has just returned from Harper's Ferry, having left there to-day. This afternoon he was in the Ferry several hours. All of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad bridges had been burned, save two spans and about three hundred yards of tressel-work.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE FIRST REGIMENT MASSACHUSETTS VOLUNTEERS.; RECEPTION BY THE SONS OF MASSACHUSETTS FROM NEW-YORK, AT THE NEW-JERSEY RAILROAD DEPOT SPEECHES AND A COLLATION, &C. WELCOMING ADDRESS OF MR. WARREN. REPLY OF COL. COWDIN. THE GREAT INSURRECTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The First Regiment Massachusetts Volunteers the pioneers of the three years' enlistments arrived at Jersey City yesterday afternoon, en route for the seat of war.
